body: Would it be enough to clear the transfer queue when the max transfer limit is reached and `—graceful` is enabled? Would that stop any new transfers to begin while still allowing the active transfers to finish? I haven’t dug into the code enough to know how feasible that is yet. Ideas?

> Would it be enough to clear the transfer queue when the max transfer limit is reached and `—graceful` is enabled? Would that stop any new transfers to begin while still allowing the active transfers to finish? I haven’t dug into the code enough to know how feasible that is yet. Ideas?

So I think a --graceful termination would require disabling the max transfer logic in `fs/accounting/accounting.go` and something like in `fs/sync/sync.go` in `pairCopyOrMove` looking for the total transfer and discarding any files from the pipe from that point.  This will empty the transfer queue and rclone will come to a halt gracefully.

Thoughts on this approach
- only works for sync/copy/move - the current approach works for any rclone command
- emptying the transfer pipeline won't stop the reading/checking pipeline so rclone may do more work than is necessary - fixing this may be hard!

Neither of those are show-stoppers as long as they are documented.
Hi I know there's a lot going on, but is this still in the backlog?
I too am eagerly waiting for this to be available.
Also curious if this feature is being worked on.

As an alternative, I'd like to suggest that `--max-transfers` avoid copying anything that *would* exceed the transfer limit. Maybe there's two modes to the `--graceful` option provided here, and my option would skip over any queue items larger than the remaining limit (it would have to take all current transfers into account).

My use case is not running out of disk space ;). A default behaviour of checking for available disk space on the target when going through the queue could be implemented on top of this.

#1599 would probably also benefit from this.

@Saviq interesting idea..

So we might have 3 modes for `--max-transfer`
- hard cutoff at the limit (current)
- graceful stop after the limit is reached
- graceful stop before the limit is reached

I also have a patch for `--max-duration` which could use the same features.

So I propose a new flag `--cutoff-mode` with the following options
- `hard` - stop immediately the limit is reached
- `soft` or maybe `graceful` - finish existing transfers and finish when the limit is reached
- `cautious` - try to stop before the limit is reached

issue.title: fs: Add support for max transfer cutoff mode #2672

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

Implement max transfer cut off mode.
Added new flags `--max-transfer-(hard,soft,cautious)`

Defaults to `--max-transfer-hard`.

Specifiying `--max-transfer-hard` will stop transferring immediately
when Rclone reaches the limit.

Specifiying `--max-transfer-soft` will stop starting new transfers
when Rclone reaches the limit.

Specifiying `--max-transfer-cautious` will try to prevent Rclone
from reaching the limit.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

The feature is requested in #2672 

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

Any news on this? Would love to hear about it

Implement max transfer cut off mode.
Added new flags `--max-transfer-(hard,soft,cautious)`

Defaults to `--max-transfer-hard`.

Specifiying `--max-transfer-hard` will stop transferring immediately
when Rclone reaches the limit.

Specifiying `--max-transfer-soft` will stop starting new transfers
when Rclone reaches the limit.

from reaching the limit.

body:
i was using the cutoff method in the latest beta version and if i am using soft cutoff and have 3 transfers for example, it will wait till one of those is finished (soft cutoff) and will hard cutoff the other transfers.
if i am using --transfers 1 it is working as it should (as there is nothing to hard cutoff if the only transfer is finished)
@Friday13th87 do you think this is related to https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4002 ?
